poem:
Title: "The binary portrait"

In an image of innocence, a saintly child,
Crafted by pain, the artist eruditely reconciled.
Commotion in ether's space, the digital ordeal,
Ingrates with opinions, a personality they steal.
"Hellish," was the mirror held by online crowd,
Deformed depiction, words callously loud.
Yet art rebirths, forgiveness paints in colours serene,
The portrait of the self, humanity unseen.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I spend less time self-sabotaging’: Robbie Williams and Joe Lycett on making art Joe Lycett and Robbie Williams were brought together by Instagram. Last August, Williams posted a painting of a small, saintly looking child (not him), and captioned it with an account of how he had once made the mistake of reading the comments below a Mail Online piece. “It was hellish,” he wrote. “The person (me) they were describing was the most horrendous". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
